title: Bedcover, 1750–1800
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: plain compound cloth, brocaded
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt
description: Bedspread (made in 19th century from old fabric) and two fragments of same material. White ribbed silk with vertical taffeta stripes. Brocaded design, in polychrome silks and rose and red chenille, of serpentine rose vines (over taffeta areas) and scattered floral sprays.

tombstone.epitaph:
Bedcover, 1750–1800.
1750–1800. Medium: silk
Technique: plain compound cloth, brocaded. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt. 1931-4-19-a,b.
